name: Eka Seitsemas
text_appearance:
He stands at around 1.8m with a broad and relatively muscular build. He has heavy burn scars on his bald face, mostly concealed by numerous faceplates, making any facial movement look like insectile chitin moving around. (The pilot pic was the closest I could get)

He's got a "1" and "7" tattoed to his right shoulder.

He usually wears his heardsuit with his weaponry and explosives attached, but within his free time he likes to wear the traditional wear of his now gone home. (Imagine bedouin clothing)
notes:
The sins of flame and his homebound flock. -Power source

Take Bonded 2 with Pelivan

Where does the believer go, if faith betrayed itself.
history:
Eka Seitsemas is an Ex-Priest of a defunct cult, hailing from a barren desert world in an unnamed system.

Eka was made to be a Lancer Pilot, an illegal flash-clone of dubious origin, indoctrinated and groomed to bring the firey message of his faith to the yet-to-be believers and ash and soot to those deemed heretics.

Within the system the cult started and expanded their operations. They uprooted and replaced the prelevant powerstructures with those of the all-holy "Meesiah". Often through fire and exploitation, ashes to ashes.

Eka, then "1" "7", was one of the vanguards, often leading the charges and destroying whatever was deemed heretical. As such, he often witnessed horrors but thought nothing of it, for they were heretics and the Messiah was justice, dust to dust.

But his faith was shaken when inside the flames of war, on the last planet in the system, he fought a Lancer who looked eerily similar to himself. Whether it was the original or another clone he did not know, but as he won the fight, his assumed brother spoke a trigger word: Cenusa.

Within a flash of memories that seemed to last forever, he remembered faces, battles, emotions, the Messiah. They revealed to him the destination they would be heading to, Sol enflamed, humanity reduced to the sand within desert winds they all hailed from.

"1" "7" had changed with the aftershocks, no longer the Priest spreading the faith but also not fully changed to the man in his memories. He turned on his false brothers, the destruction they wrought together laid bare as atrocities before him.

He joined the local powers, begged them to let him aid in returning the fires to the sands. His memories told him that the Union would surely destroy the Messiah along with his faith, but until they arrived he had to fight against them with any alliance he could make, no matter how shaky. 

Union arrived, the cult was no more. Ashes to ashes.

"1" "7" proved himself valuable, was reeducated within Union. A new name for coming battles "Eka Seitsemas" , dust to dust.

But his memories tell him, the cult is still alive and they must be ereased from memory. No ashes and dust, only oblivion.

systems.flavorDescription: In space, simplicity in form and function guarantees reliability and promotes trust. The Argonaut is one of IPS-N’s oldest designs, hailing from the pre-merger days of Northstar’s Deep Black security teams. It’s a simple slab of metal carried in hand or mounted on a chassis’ brachial superstructure; the only option a pilot has for customizing this shield is a choice of size.

IPS-N’s “Portable Bunker” is actually a series of single-use expanding printer sheets: flat-pack pouches of inert non-Newtonian fluid that, when deployed, become a rigid structure capable of withstanding incredible force.

Guillermo, no es suficiente saber caminar; Debes saber dónde y dónde no pisar. El lugar incorrecto, y te perderás. Es en un plano de telaraña donde construimos nuestro hogar: pise ligeramente cuando vaya.
[Guillermo, it is not enough to know how to walk; you must know where and where not to step; the incorrect spot, and you will be lost. It is on a plane of gossamer that we make our home: tread lightly when you go.]

weapon.flavorDescription: Concussion missiles are fitted with overpressure-generating charges with low shatter and low incandescence – they’re meant to stun, deter, push back, and disorient, usually in tandem with a larger, more lethal attack.

The Leviathan Heavy Assault Cannon (HAC) is a massive, multi-barrel rotary cannon fed by an external reservoir, usually dorsally mounted on the chassis carrying it. Unmodified, the Leviathan should only be fired within the recommended burst timing specifications to prevent percussive trauma to joints and pilots.
In partnership with Harrison Armory’s Think Tank, IPS-N is currently investigating remote solutions for the cannon’s ammunition consumption demands.

armor.flavorDescription: The heaviest hardsuits. They are always powered and up-armored with thick, composite armor. Heavy hardsuits often feature integrated weapons, powerful mobility suites, and – by augmenting their user’s strength – allow their user to field much heavier weapons than normal infantry can typically carry. Heavy hardsuits are in decline now that half-size chassis are popular, but they are still common among private militaries and middle-tier Diasporan armed forces.

weapons.note: Energy, think lightning ball from Titanfall 2
weapons.flavorDescription: Heavy signature weapons are missile tubes, heavy lasers, light machine gun, or exotic rifles.
Light A/C weapons might be knives, bayonets, punching daggers, and short swords.

gear.flavorDescription: A miniaturized version of Union’s full-scale printers, handheld printers can be used to make simple objects out of flexible and durable plastic – as long as you have the right pattern chip.
This kit contains many essentials for surviving in hostile environments: a rebreather, water filters, hardsuit patches, backup thermals, a bivouac kit, and so on.

Expend a charge for the following effect:
  • Thermite Charge (Mine, Burst 1): This charge must be remotely detonated as a quick action. Affected characters must succeed on an Engineering save or take 3 Energy AP. Thermal charges automatically hit objects, dealing 10 Energy AP.
